intro: Nyctago hortensis, commonly known as nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, followed by the development of berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Nyctago hortensis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. However, it is important to note that some species within this genus contain toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
